intro: Chailletia cymosa, commonly known as the clustered chailletia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in cymes, giving it a delicate appearance. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other umbellifers, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Chailletia cymosa thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
